channel.title: Frontier | 443
channel.description:
This is meant to be released as a test base for those people who want to develop for 443 but do not have any platforms to gain information from. This includes login, walking, but does not include any item handling since that was sort of messy. Just leave it at that. This would be excellent if you're wanting to learn some more modern protocol. This will work on any release 443 client, and you are not required to have a cache for that client to be able to connect to this server since the ukeys are generated and stored in the cache database. Oh I don't think I mentioned, the cache is stored in a SQL database and there are examples of how you can manipulate or use that information in the server.
[b]This loads 377 maps.[/b] I left in the file that allows you to load in maps from different revisions, but be warned, because I never finished the cache API to rebuild archives you cannot input new objects (and possibly models). None of the maps are encrypted.
This loads music from, I think, 64*. I added it in because this revision contained absolutely no music. I also left the file to rebuild music into the archives database.
I have a region system implemented with this that is used for updating. It is fast. Very fast. I haven't bench marked the times for this particular version but for those of you who needed a few design ideas this may help you out.
Most of the configuring is done through SQL. The tables are listed below, I'm sure if you want to use them you will know how to set this up.
itemdefs
[code=sql] /* Navicat MySQL Data Transfer
Source Server : Localhost Source Server Version : 50163 Source Host : localhost:3306 Source Database : evelus_master
Target Server Type : MYSQL Target Server Version : 50163 File Encoding : 65001
Date: 2012-09-03 11:35:05 */
SET FOREIGN_KEY_CHECKS=0;
-- ---------------------------- -- Table structure for `evelus_itemdefs` -- ---------------------------- DROP TABLE IF EXISTS `evelus_itemdefs`; CREATE TABLE `evelus_itemdefs` ( `item_id` smallint(6) NOT NULL, `name` char(32) DEFAULT '', `is_stackable` tinyint(1) DEFAULT '0', `equipment_slot` tinyint(4) DEFAULT '-1', `listener_id` smallint(4) DEFAULT '-1', PRIMARY KEY (`item_id`) ) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=ascii;
-- ---------------------------- -- Records of evelus_itemdefs -- ---------------------------- INSERT INTO `evelus_itemdefs` VALUES ('1289', 'stuff', '1', '0', '-1'); INSERT INTO `evelus_itemdefs` VALUES ('133', 'yayaya', '0', '-1', '-1'); [/code]
widgetdefs [code] /* Navicat MySQL Data Transfer
Source Server : Localhost Source Server Version : 50163 Source Host : localhost:3306 Source Database : evelus_master
Target Server Type : MYSQL Target Server Version : 50163 File Encoding : 65001
Date: 2012-09-03 11:35:12 */
SET FOREIGN_KEY_CHECKS=0;
-- ---------------------------- -- Table structure for `evelus_widgetdefs` -- ---------------------------- DROP TABLE IF EXISTS `evelus_widgetdefs`; CREATE TABLE `evelus_widgetdefs` ( `widget_id` smallint(11) NOT NULL, `widget_hash` int(11) NOT NULL, `name` char(64) NOT NULL DEFAULT '', `type` tinyint(4) DEFAULT '-1', `container_id` tinyint(4) DEFAULT '-1', `container_size` smallint(6) DEFAULT '-1', `button_id` smallint(6) DEFAULT '-1', `window_id` smallint(6) DEFAULT '-1', `listener_id` smallint(6) DEFAULT '-1', PRIMARY KEY (`widget_id`,`widget_hash`,`name`) ) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=ascii;
-- ---------------------------- -- Records of evelus_widgetdefs -- ---------------------------- INSERT INTO `evelus_widgetdefs` VALUES ('0', '9764864', 'inventory_container', '0', '0', '28', '-1', '-1', '-1'); INSERT INTO `evelus_widgetdefs` VALUES ('1', '11927558', 'logout_button', '2', '-1', '-1', '0', '-1', '0'); INSERT INTO `evelus_widgetdefs` VALUES ('2', '25362456', 'display_equipment_button', '2', '-1', '-1', '1', '-1', '1'); INSERT INTO `evelus_widgetdefs` VALUES ('3', '30539775', 'equipment_widget', '3', '-1', '-1', '-1', '0', '0'); [/code]
If you want a blank client: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=555200.0 If you want a partially refactored client: https://github.com/Hadyn/frontier/zipball/master
[u]Features:[/u]
[ul][li] Asynchronous Netty networking[/li] [li]Ondemand complete[/li] [li]Login complete[/li] [li]Walking (not minimap/object interaction)[/li] [li]Start to player updating (updating is what was left to finish)[/li][/ul]
[u]Media[/u]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/p4FCA.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/giFB9.png[/img]
[u]Download[/u]
http://www.mediafire.com/?t8fgaar10du48x5

item.description:

Nebulae:

Is this your own server written from scratch, yes? If I was to get this running would there be anything in my way from progressing to a fully playable server?

Yes & yes.

item.title: Frontier | 443
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

the elve age:

Great work man, are you completely done with this? And why isnâ€™t it loading 443 maps?

Theyâ€™re encrypted and no one has mapdata. The base had some terminal design problems that was making it tougher and tougher to work with so I stopped and reevaluated my approach. This is finished.

Read full topic

item.title: Frontier | 443
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

This is meant to be released as a test base for those people who want to develop for 443 but do not have any platforms to gain information from. This includes login, walking, but does not include any item handling since that was sort of messy. Just leave it at that. This would be excellent if youâ€™re wanting to learn some more modern protocol. This will work on any release 443 client, and you are not required to have a cache for that client to be able to connect to this server since the ukeys are generated and stored in the cache database. Oh I donâ€™t think I mentioned, the cache is stored in a SQL database and there are examples of how you can manipulate or use that information in the server.

This loads 377 maps. I left in the file that allows you to load in maps from different revisions, but be warned, because I never finished the cache API to rebuild archives you cannot input new objects (and possibly models). None of the maps are encrypted.

This loads music from, I think, 64*. I added it in because this revision contained absolutely no music. I also left the file to rebuild music into the archives database.

I have a region system implemented with this that is used for updating. It is fast. Very fast. I havenâ€™t bench marked the times for this particular version but for those of you who needed a few design ideas this may help you out.

Most of the configuring is done through SQL. The tables are listed below, Iâ€™m sure if you want to use them you will know how to set this up.

itemdefs

/*
Navicat MySQL Data Transfer

Source Server         : Localhost
Source Server Version : 50163
Source Host           : localhost:3306
Source Database       : evelus_master

Target Server Type    : MYSQL
Target Server Version : 50163
File Encoding         : 65001

Date: 2012-09-03 11:35:05
*/

SET FOREIGN_KEY_CHECKS=0;

-- ----------------------------
-- Table structure for `evelus_itemdefs`
-- ----------------------------
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS `evelus_itemdefs`;
CREATE TABLE `evelus_itemdefs` (
  `item_id` smallint(6) NOT NULL,
  `name` char(32) DEFAULT '',
  `is_stackable` tinyint(1) DEFAULT '0',
  `equipment_slot` tinyint(4) DEFAULT '-1',
  `listener_id` smallint(4) DEFAULT '-1',
  PRIMARY KEY (`item_id`)
) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=ascii;

-- ----------------------------
-- Records of evelus_itemdefs
-- ----------------------------
INSERT INTO `evelus_itemdefs` VALUES ('1289', 'stuff', '1', '0', '-1');
INSERT INTO `evelus_itemdefs` VALUES ('133', 'yayaya', '0', '-1', '-1');

widgetdefs

/*
Navicat MySQL Data Transfer

Source Server         : Localhost
Source Server Version : 50163
Source Host           : localhost:3306
Source Database       : evelus_master

Target Server Type    : MYSQL
Target Server Version : 50163
File Encoding         : 65001

Date: 2012-09-03 11:35:12
*/

SET FOREIGN_KEY_CHECKS=0;

-- ----------------------------
-- Table structure for `evelus_widgetdefs`
-- ----------------------------
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS `evelus_widgetdefs`;
CREATE TABLE `evelus_widgetdefs` (
  `widget_id` smallint(11) NOT NULL,
  `widget_hash` int(11) NOT NULL,
  `name` char(64) NOT NULL DEFAULT '',
  `type` tinyint(4) DEFAULT '-1',
  `container_id` tinyint(4) DEFAULT '-1',
  `container_size` smallint(6) DEFAULT '-1',
  `button_id` smallint(6) DEFAULT '-1',
  `window_id` smallint(6) DEFAULT '-1',
  `listener_id` smallint(6) DEFAULT '-1',
  PRIMARY KEY (`widget_id`,`widget_hash`,`name`)
) ENGINE=MyISAM DEFAULT CHARSET=ascii;

-- ----------------------------
-- Records of evelus_widgetdefs
-- ----------------------------
INSERT INTO `evelus_widgetdefs` VALUES ('0', '9764864', 'inventory_container', '0', '0', '28', '-1', '-1', '-1');
INSERT INTO `evelus_widgetdefs` VALUES ('1', '11927558', 'logout_button', '2', '-1', '-1', '0', '-1', '0');
INSERT INTO `evelus_widgetdefs` VALUES ('2', '25362456', 'display_equipment_button', '2', '-1', '-1', '1', '-1', '1');
INSERT INTO `evelus_widgetdefs` VALUES ('3', '30539775', 'equipment_widget', '3', '-1', '-1', '-1', '0', '0');

If you want a blank client: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=555200.0
If you want a partially refactored client: https://github.com/Hadyn/frontier/zipball/master

Features:

[ul][li] Asynchronous Netty networking[/li]
[li]Ondemand complete[/li]
[li]Login complete[/li]
[li]Walking (not minimap/object interaction)[/li]
[li]Start to player updating (updating is what was left to finish)[/li][/ul]
